data.title: Shahid Kapoor reveals he did not charge any fees for Haider
data.meta_description: Shahid Kapoor reveals he did not charge any fees for Haider. Shahid Kapoor did not take any fees for Vishal Bhardwaj’s H
data.text:
Following their 2009 criminal drama Kaminey, Shahid Kapoor and Vishal Bhardwaj teamed up once more in 2014 for the drama Haider, which is set in Kashmir and is based on Hamlet by William Shakespeare. The actor won his first Filmfare Award for Best Actor after receiving significant appreciation for his portrayal of the movie's title character.

Shahid Kapoor recently discussed his intention to work on Haider for free in an interview. The actor explained in an interview, "They couldn’t afford me. They said if they had to pay me, then the budget of the film wouldn’t get sanctioned because it was a very experimental subject. They really didn’t know if it would land at all but it was a very compelling kind of product to make and so I said, ‘Yeah, I will do it for free'."

When the actor was asked if he has acted in any of his other projects without taking his fees, he stated, "It was the only time I did it. It just happened at that time", and laughingly added, "Ghar bhi chalana hai."

Haider, which also stars Tabu, Kay Kay Menon, Shraddha Kapoor, and Irrfan Khan, is one of the most well-liked movies of the past decade. Moreover, the film also received several National Awards.

Shahid Kapoor will next be seen opposite Kriti Sanon in an untitled romance drama. The movie, which is being produced by Dinesh Vijan, Jyoti Deshpande, and Laxman Utekar and is being directed by Amit Joshi and Aradhana Sah, is set to open in theatres on December 7 of this year.
